that was a sour ending to a tense

emerge from this well this was always
going to be a fractious gathering I
think a bad-tempered one given that
there are substantial disagreements
about NATO's future purpose its
priorities its ability to deliver but in
fact at today's formal sessions the 29
leaders there were some successes - they
averted a major crisis heading off a
threat from Turkey to block a plan to
boost the defenses of the Baltic States
against a Russian threat an exchange
president Erdogan of Turkey got some

to declare space a new operational

their disagreements but they made
progress with others they declared China
a potential challenge a
but I think behind all this Donald Trump
was as he so often is the key player he
castigated members not paying enough as
he sees it for their defense he
pointedly invited to lunch those who met
the spending criteria that NATO has set
and I think it was very typical this

gatherings we've come to expect in the
Trump era democracy's falling out with
